distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text: Updated Satellite 6.7 packages that fix several bugs are now available for Red Hat Satellite.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Satellite is a system management solution that allows organizations to configure and maintain their systems without the necessity to provide public Internet access to their servers or other client systems. It performs provisioning and configuration management of predefined standard operating environments.

This update fixes the following bugs:

1826603	Remote execution job fails with TypeError (no implicit conversion of Array into String
1846670	Unable to apply all Errata via Remote Execution on Web UI with "Select All"
1869170	When delete the hypervisor from satellite, the manifest will be broken
1881186	Backport of bugzilla 1871873 to Satellite 6.7/Candlepin 2.9
1884006	Hits Sync uses only old proxy setting
1884009	Hostgroup tag is never reported in slice
1884021	Unable to sync large openshift docker repos
1884025	[Regression] Hammer export-legacy Fails with Composite Content Views
1884026	Hypervisors from Satellite, never makes their way to HBI
1884027	After data upload from satellite UI it is not visible on cloud.redhat.com.
1884029	build pxe default do not work when more than 1 provider

Users of Red Hat Satellite are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs.
notes.title: Details

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: Red Hat Satellite's external authentication component is vulnerable to a full account takeover flaw. This flaw allows an attacker with an authenticated account on Single sign-on (SSO) to gain elevated privileges of existing local users. This issue only affects users who have configured Satellite to use Apache SSO or Open ID Connect external authentication sources, and that have not disabled the auto-creation of users on login. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Satellite: Local user impersonation by Single sign-on (SSO) user leads to account takeover
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For detailed instructions how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_satellite/6.7/html/upgrading_and_updating_red_hat_satellite/updating_satellite_server_capsule_server_and_content_hosts
This issue can be mitigated by disabling the external login if a Satellite user has their authentication set to INTERNAL.

vulnerabilities.title: Satellite: Local user impersonation by Single sign-on (SSO) user leads to account takeover
